medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms of angina (Canadian Cardiovascular Society class III) and dyspnea (New York Heart Association functional class IV) progressed chronically. Symptoms related to pulmonary arterial hypertension were diagnosed years previously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Pulmonary arterial hypertension treated with a phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor and an endothelin-receptor antagonist.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for Marfan syndrome in her granddaughter.
